MS MCQs

    Application scalability on AKS with HorizontalPodAutoscalers - Concepts of scalability

    »

    1. What is horizontal scaling?

      When the application is replicated in order to sustain a heavier load.

      Adding more RAM to the VM.

      Rendering the application stateless so it can be used without a persistent storage.


    2. Why is it important to have a resource request set on pods bound to an HPA?

      Because this is the only way to calculate the resource utilization.

      It’s not important, but it’s recommended so the application doesn’t starve.

      So the HPA knows when to stop scaling a resource based on the resources available in the cluster.


    3. Why is vertical scaling less recommended for stateless applications?

      Because vertical scaling duplicates the applications and this is harder on stateless apps.

      Because it requires a stateful application to be vertically scaled.

      Because it’s cheaper to duplicate a stateless application than increase the resources on its VM.
